title: Number of Family Separations at U.S. Border Higher Than Previously Known
text:
WASHINGTON—The Trump administration told the American Civil Liberties Union on Thursday that immigration authorities separated more than 1,500 additional children from their families before its “zero tolerance” policy was fully implemented, bringing the total number of children separated to about 4,300 before a federal judge halted the practice.

The government provided the new figure to the ACLU, the civil-rights group said in an announcement, a day before a court-ordered deadline to account for previously unidentified family...
description: The American Civil Liberties Union said the Trump administration disclosed that more than an additional 1,500 children were separated from their families before the government’s “zero tolerance” policy was fully implemented.
